19 #define HALIDE_RUNTIME_METAL

23 /** These are forward declared here to allow clients to override the
24  * Halide Metal runtime. Do not call them. */

27  const char *src, int size);

44 
45 /** Set the underlying MTLBuffer for a halide_buffer_t. This memory should be
46  * allocated using newBufferWithLength:options or similar and must
47  * have an extent large enough to cover that specified by the halide_buffer_t
48  * extent fields. The dev field of the halide_buffer_t must be NULL when this
49  * routine is called. This call can fail due to running out of memory
50  * or being passed an invalid buffer. The device and host dirty bits
51  * are left unmodified. */
52 extern int halide_metal_wrap_buffer(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf, uint64_t buffer);
53 
54 /** Disconnect a halide_buffer_t from the memory it was previously
55  * wrapped around. Should only be called for a halide_buffer_t that
56  * halide_metal_wrap_buffer was previously called on. Frees any
57  * storage associated with the binding of the halide_buffer_t and the
58  * buffer, but does not free the MTLBuffer. The dev field of the
59  * halide_buffer_t will be NULL on return.
60  */
61 extern int halide_metal_detach_buffer(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
62 
63 /** Return the underlying MTLBuffer for a halide_buffer_t. This buffer must be
64  * valid on an Metal device, or not have any associated device
65  * memory. If there is no device memory (dev field is NULL), this
66  * returns 0.
67  */
68 extern uintptr_t halide_metal_get_buffer(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
69 
70 /** Returns the offset associated with the Metal Buffer allocation via device_crop or device_slice. */
71 extern uint64_t halide_metal_get_crop_offset(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
72 
73 struct halide_metal_device;
74 struct halide_metal_command_queue;
75 
76 /** This prototype is exported as applications will typically need to
77  * replace it to get Halide filters to execute on the same device and
78  * command queue used for other purposes. The halide_metal_device is an
79  * id <MTLDevice> and halide_metal_command_queue is an id <MTLCommandQueue>.
80  * No reference counting is done by Halide on these objects. They must remain
81  * valid until all off the following are true:
82  * - A balancing halide_metal_release_context has occurred for each
83  * halide_metal_acquire_context which returned the device/queue
84  * - All Halide filters using the context information have completed
85  * - All halide_buffer_t objects on the device have had
86  * halide_device_free called or have been detached via
87  * halide_metal_detach_buffer.
88  * - halide_device_release has been called on the interface returned from
89  * halide_metal_device_interface(). (This releases the programs on the context.)
90  */
91 extern int halide_metal_acquire_context(void *user_context, struct halide_metal_device **device_ret,
92  struct halide_metal_command_queue **queue_ret, bool create);
93 
94 /** This call balances each successfull halide_metal_acquire_context call.
95  * If halide_metal_acquire_context is replaced, this routine must be replaced
96  * as well.
97  */
98 extern int halide_metal_release_context(void *user_context);
99

101 } // End extern "C"
